tweets.text:
‚ö†Ô∏è The Lea is among the most polluted rivers in London

Swimming there risks infection and diarrhoea, with BBQs and litter causing damage to wildlife, including kingfisher and owl nests

We recently wrote to @EnvAgency to request an update on work to tackle pollution in the river https://t.co/JMMo4ca5Cn

domain.name: Ongoing News Story
domain.description: Ongoing News Stories like 'Brexit'

tweets.text: @gis_michelle @EnvAgency You have misunderstood my question. Why do you give the impression that all rivers are dirty all of the time, when in fact the purpose of the map is to show where to avoid only at those places alerted and only after heavy rain?
Behind the scenes as leaky dams are installed at Aiken Beck @Whinlatter - part of our Cocker catchment natural flood management project. #slowtheflow @EnvAgencyNW #weg https://t.co/vIv2dc4uk4
@gis_michelle @EnvAgency It should be a useful tool to avoid seeking in certain places after heavy rain, so why does publicity give the impression that rivers are never clean to swim in?

The risks from #flooding and #CoastalErosion are set to increase due to #ClimateChange. We all need to play our part in understanding our risk and knowing how to become more resilient for the future - read about our new strategy and share your views here: https://t.co/d6TLjF9ZVB https://t.co/bZYUVBwJel

tweets.text:
Have a read about our new project which uses role play to help communicate about #flooding to at risk communities in the @yorkshirepost 

Our exciting project is in partnership with @LeedsCC_News 
@CityofYork @EnvAgencyYNE & @LivingWithH2O 
https://t.co/SiMBmk0V6g https://t.co/PUEllrpJCp
@BrookersDollis @EnvAgencySE Where is the reply?
@VerValleySoc @EnvAgencySE That's awful! Which section is that?

Great video by @EnvAgencySW with Dr Richard Smith @rsmithsoil showing a typical #soil erosion incident in the South West to raise awareness & understanding about the issue and the challenges farmers face: https://t.co/DT9NlQZsjL
See the @EnvAgencySE reply! Understandable as the Brook flows through the farmland - but even at the source?! https://t.co/Q65YLoCJvf

@BrookersDollis @aoliverjourno @MaryDuffinator @anne_clarke @Barneteye @rozgab @stephenshouse @silkstreamers @welshharpies The Brook used to be regularly contaminated by run off from one neighbouring farm so I certainly wouldn‚Äôt think the water is safe, no!

Eely good news with river temperatures picking up towards 12¬∞C #Eels are on the move.
These were caught as part of the monitoring at one of our gauging station pumped passes in #Gloucestershire - looks like it‚Äôs working üëçüèª  @SEGandrewK @EnvAgencyMids @robleedavies @severnrivers https://t.co/e2gjRx37Gv

@StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @BorisJohnson @EnvAgency I work in a local high school near this and every day get asked about it as it smells inside and outside!. I have no escape I go home my clothes smell of it to then walk into my home for the house to smell of it with no open windows!. Enough is enough!

A217 Bishopsford Road/London Road collapsed bridge update 8 Apr 2021

Cloudy water in the River Wandle originating at the #MitchamBridge site as works continue to reopen the bridge closed so far for 716 days. @Wandle_Trust @WandleForum @wand https://t.co/Kl2AlDlyIZ

Thousands of litres of possibly contaminated water from an HS2 site will pass along this ditch and go straight into the River Colne, a chalk stream already under immense pressure. Disastrous.

tweets.text: Excellent work by the @theriverstrust on unpicking the complex and shocking #sewagemap data. Now easy for the public to see: sewage is a massive threat to our freshwater ecosystems, and the system must change @EnvAgency #endsewagepollution @gis_michelle https://t.co/r4II0CHidT

Have the @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA agreed that they start to dump waste on cell 3? Where is your statement? You are failing our town- what are you going to do about this? @StinkStopthe https://t.co/VhqevBdxxy

We will not be silenced until our children are protected. The government authorities are not resolving this @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland . @BorisJohnson you need to step in @StinkStopthe https://t.co/0vYyfqHaEW
